groups.description: Specific options for SyN distortion correction
groups.name: SyN options

inputs.description: Subject folder for BIDS (folders name should be sub-XXXXX).
inputs.name: subject_dir

inputs.description: The name of the output for the outcomes of preprocessing and visual reports
inputs.name: output_dir_name
task_id
inputs.description: Select a specific task to be processed

inputs.name: echo_idx
inputs.description: Select a specific echo to be processed in a multiecho series

inputs.name: anat_derivatives
inputs.description: Reuse the anatomical derivatives from another NiBabies run or calculated with an alternative processing tool (NOT RECOMMENDED).

inputs.name: nipype plugin file
inputs.description: Nipype plugin configuration file.

inputs.name: anat only
inputs.description: Run anatomical workflows only.

inputs.name: boilerplate_only
inputs.description: Generate boilerplate only.

inputs.name: md_only_boilerplate
inputs.description: Skip generation of HTML and LaTeX formatted citation with pandoc.

inputs.name: error_on_aroma_warnings
inputs.description: Raise an error if ICA_AROMA does not produce sensible output (e.g., if all the components are classified as signal or noise).

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.description: Increases log verbosity for each occurence (-vvv).

inputs.name: ignore
inputs.description: Ignore selected aspects of the input dataset to disable corresponding parts of the workflow (a space delimited list).

inputs.name: longitudinal
inputs.description: Treat dataset as longitudinal - may increase runtime.

inputs.name: output_spaces
inputs.description:
Standard and non-standard spaces to resample anatomical and functional images to.
Standard spaces may be specified by the form <SPACE>[:cohort-<label>][:res-<resolution>][...], where <SPACE> is a keyword designating a spatial reference, and may be followed by optional, colon-separated parameters.
Non-standard spaces imply specific orientations and sampling grids.
Important to note, the res-* modifier does not define the resolution used for the spatial normalization.
To generate no BOLD outputs, use this option without specifying any spatial references.
For further details, please check out https://fmriprep.readthedocs.io/en/latest/spaces.html

inputs.name: me_output_echos
inputs.description:
Output individual echo time series with slice, motion and susceptibility correction.
Useful for further Tedana processing post-NiBabies.

inputs.name: bold2t1w_init
inputs.description: Either 'register' to initialize volumes at center or 'header' to use the header information when coregistering BOLD to T1w images.

inputs.name: bold2t1w_dof
inputs.description: Degrees of freedom when registering BOLD to T1w images.

inputs.name: force_bbr
inputs.description: Always use boundary-based registration (no goodness-of-fit checks)

inputs.name: force_no_bbr
inputs.description: Do not use boundary-based registration (no goodness-of-fit checks).

inputs.name: medial_surface_nan
inputs.description:
Replace medial wall values with NaNs on functional GIFTI files.
Only performed for GIFTI files mapped to a freesurfer subject (fsaverage or fsnative).

inputs.name: slice_time_ref
inputs.description:
The time of the reference slice to correct BOLD values to, as a fraction acquisition time.
0 indicates the start, 0.5 the midpoint, and 1 the end of acquisition.
The alias start corresponds to 0, and middle to 0.5.

inputs.name: dummy_scans
inputs.description: Number of non steady state volumes.

inputs.name: random_seed
inputs.description: Initialize the random seed for the workflow.

inputs.name: use_aroma
inputs.description: Add ICA_AROMA to your preprocessing stream.

inputs.name: aroma_melodic_dimensionality
inputs.description: Exact or maximum number of MELODIC components to estimate (positive = exact, negative = maximum)

inputs.name: return_all_components
inputs.description: Include all components estimated in CompCor decomposition in the confounds file instead of only the components sufficient to explain 50 percent of BOLD variance in each CompCor mask.

inputs.name: fd_spike_threshold
inputs.description: Threshold for flagging a frame as an outlier on the basis of framewise displacement.

inputs.name: dvars_skipe_threshold
inputs.description: Threshold for flagging a frame as an outlier on the basis of standardised DVARS.

inputs.name: skull_strip_template
inputs.description: Select a template for skull-stripping with antsBrainExtraction.

inputs.name: skull_strip_fixed_seed
inputs.description: Do not use a random seed for skull-stripping - will ensure run-to-run replicability when used with -omp-nthreads 1 and matching -random-seed <int>

inputs.name: skull_strip_t1w
inputs.description:
Determiner for T1-weighted skull stripping
('force' ensures skull stripping, 'skip' ignores skull stripping, and 'auto' applies brain extraction based on the outcome of a heuristic to check whether the brain is already masked).

inputs.name: fmap_bspline
inputs.description: Fit a B-Spline field using least-squares (experimental).

inputs.name: fmap_no_demean
inputs.description: Do not remove median (within mask) from fieldmap.

inputs.name: use_syn_sdc
inputs.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Use fieldmap-free distortion correction

inputs.name: force_syn
inputs.description: EXPERIMENTAL/TEMPORARY: Use SyN correction in addition to fieldmap correction, if available.

inputs.name: fs_license_file
inputs.description:
Path to FreeSurfer license key file.
Get it (for free) by registering at https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/registration.html

inputs.name: no_submm_recon
inputs.description: Disable sub-millimeter (hires) reconstruction

inputs.name: cifti_output
inputs.description:
Output preprocessed BOLD as a CIFTI dense timeseries.
Optionally, the number of grayordinate can be specified (default is 91k, which equates to 2mm resolution). Possible choices 91k, 170k.

inputs.name: fs_no_reconall
inputs.description: Disable FreeSurfer surface preprocessing.

inputs.name: output_layout
inputs.description:
Organization of outputs. bids (default) places NiBabies derivatives directly in the output directory, and defaults to placing FreeSurfer derivatives in <output-dir>/sourcedata/freesurfer.
legacy creates derivative datasets as subdirectories of outputs.

inputs.name: resource_monitor
inputs.description: Enable Nipype's resource monitoring to keep track of memory and CPU usage.

inputs.name: reports_only
inputs.description: Only generate reports, don't run workflows. This will only rerun report aggregation, not reportlet generation for specific nodes.

inputs.name: config_file
inputs.description: Use pre-generated configuration file. Values in file will be overridden by command-line arguments.

inputs.name: write_graph
inputs.description: Write workflow graph.

inputs.name: stop_on_first_crash
inputs.description: Force stopping on first crash, even if a work directory was specified.

inputs.name: notrack
inputs.description:
Opt-out of sending tracking information of this run to the NiBabies developers.
This information helps to improve NiBabies and provides an indicator of real world usage crucial for obtaining funding.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Debug mode(s) to enable. 'all' is alias for all available modes.

inputs.name: sloppy
inputs.description: Use low-quality tools for speed - TESTING ONLY.

inputs.name: age_months
inputs.description: Age in months. Using this flag is highly recommended.

inputs.name: segmentation_atlases_dir
inputs.description: Directory containing precalculated segmentations to use for JointLabelFusion.

inputs.name: fd_radius
inputs.description: Head radius in mm for framewise displacement calculation.

inputs.name: derivatives
inputs.description: One or more directory containing pre-computed derivatives.

inputs.name: deriv_filter_file
inputs.description: A JSON file for customizing the derivatives queries.

output-files.name: Output Directory
output-files.description: This is the directory where the overall outputs are to be stored.

custom.cbrain:author: Erik Lee <leex6144@umn.edu>, Timothy Hendrickson <hendr522@umn.edu> and Natacha Beck <natacha.beck@mcgill.ca>
